path: UNISA/98906 - BSc Science in Computing/COS3711 - Advanced Programming/Unsorted/Notes/COS3711_Using_Ezust_Libraries_on_Qt_6.pdf
text: COS3711 Using Ezust Libraries on Qt 6 Using the Ezust libraries on an already existing Qt 6 installation: Step 1: Locate the Qt file on your computer, this is usually on the C drive, once you find the file open it and scroll down to maintenance tool, run the tool as administrator. Step 2: Login to your Qt account and click next. Step 3: On the setup page, select ‘Add or remove components’ if it is not already selected and click next. Step 4: On the select components screen, expand Qt then expand Qt 5.13.2, from the list of components select MinGW 7.3.0 32-bit or 64-bit according to the specifications of your computer, this installation will require approximately 1.3GB. After the installation follow the instructions in Tutorial letter 103 Practical guide and use MinGW 7.3.0 to run the lib.pro file.
